Kenneth Stanley wrote:

>
>Colin, when you say there are opportunities in the UK job market,
>are you thinking just in terms of jobs in general or do you mean 
>possibly using NEAT in a real application?  What do you currently do 
>for a living?
>  
>
Sorry yeh I was meaning just in general. It would be nice to work in 
neuro-evolution but I really don't really know who is using it that 
might have job openings. Just from web surfing, etc. I am vaguely aware 
that some banks have AI agents to assist with trading - but how advanced 
are they? And then there is Natural Motion Ltd that Tyler posted a link 
to a while ago (the site with the commercial 'walker' type software), 
they are in Oxford.

As for me, I do software development in a small financial company right 
now. The occasional challenging project comes my way but there's been a 
fair bit of code monkey type work over the years. Actually it's a 
regular observation of mine that the less challenging the work the more 
money is offered :)

Colin
